title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement gregoriofernandezperrier@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: outlines propose change PaqueteNuevo. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("goyoioio/PaqueteNuevo", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to PaqueteNuevo
text: Please note PaqueteNuevo project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Paquete para analizar datos meteorologicos
text: El objetivo del paquete nuevo es facilitar el analisas de datos meteorologicos

title: Paquete para analizar datos meteorologicos
text: Pueden instalar la version de desarrollo de PaqueteNuevo desde GitHub :

title: Paquete para analizar datos meteorologicos
text: este es un ejemplo basico que muestra como resolver un problema comun: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(PaqueteNuevo) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Convierte Temperatura de Celsius a Fahrenheit — celsius_to_fahrenheit
title: Convierte Temperatura de Celsius a Fahrenheit — celsius_to_fahrenheit
text: La función celsius_to_fahrenheit toma una temperatura en grados Celsius y la convierte en grados Fahrenheit.

title: Convierte Temperatura de Celsius a Fahrenheit — celsius_to_fahrenheit
Convierte Temperatura de Celsius a Fahrenheit — celsius_to_fahrenheit
text: temp_centigrados Una temperatura en grado Celsius.

title: Convierte Temperatura de Celsius a Fahrenheit — celsius_to_fahrenheit
text: La temperatura ingresada pero en grados Fahrenheit.

title: Descargar datos meteorológicos — descargar_datos
text: La función descargar_datos toma el ID de una estación y un directorio de destino, y descarga en dicha ubicación un archivo CSV con los datos meteorológicos de la estación correspondiente. Los IDs posibles son: NH0098, NH0046, NH437, NH472 y NH0910.

title: Descargar datos meteorológicos — descargar_datos
text: id_estacion ID de la estación. directorio_destino Directorio donde se guardará el archivo CSV.

title: Descargar datos meteorológicos — descargar_datos
text: Un archivo CSV con los datos meteorológicos de la estación con el ID ingresado.

title: Descargar datos meteorológicos — descargar_datos
code: descargar_datos("NH0098", "data") #> Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details, #> e.g.: #>   dat <- vroom(...) #>   problems(dat) #> Rows: 23733 Columns: 35 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr   (2): id, direccion_viento_1000cm #> dbl  (21): temperatura_abrigo_150cm, temperatura_abrigo_150cm_maxima, temper... #> lgl  (11): temperatura_intemperie_50cm_minima, temperatura_inte_5cm, tempera... #> date  (1): fecha #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # title: Conjunto de datos — estaciones_merged
text: Los datos contienen información de las distintas estaciones meteorológicas.

title: Conjunto de datos — estaciones_merged
text: Los datos son obtenidos de un repositorio de GitHub. estaciones_merged muestra de datos de todas las estaciones.

title: Conjunto de datos — estaciones_merged
text: Fuente: repositorio de GitHub.

what: Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
title: Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
text: La función tabla_resumen_temperatura crea una tabla de resumen de la temperatura_abrigo_150cm para una o más estaciones.

title: Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
text: datos data.frame de las estaciones de cuya temperatura abrigo se quiere crear una tabla resumen.

title: Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
text: Devuelve una tabla resumen de la temperatura abrigo de las estaciones ingresadas.

title: Crea una Tabla Resumen de la Temperatura Abrigo — tabla_resumen_temperatura
code: # Cargar los datos de ejemplo desde el paquete
